title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Garden Scene from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service], 1821–24
title_raw: Plate Design:  Garden Scene from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: A garden setting with an arbor, right middleground, and a trellised fence around a house/garden building, left foreground.  A kneeling woman assists a young boy who has falllen to the ground.  Behind them, a gardener raises his arms in exclamation.  A woman stands in the doorway of the house/garden building holding a vase of flowers.  A young boy, left middleground, brings a bunch of flowers to her.  Another kneeling woman, left foreground, fills a vase with flowers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Garden Scene from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service], 1821–24. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper. 
1989-13-7.
